clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of Polymetric Clips (Hem-o-Lok) Versus Historical Endoscopic Staplers for Laparoscopic Appendectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study of Polymetric Clips (Hem-o-Lok) Versus Historical Endoscopic Staplers for Laparoscopic Appendectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the outcomes of appendectomy performed with polymetric clips (Hem-o-lok速) versus endoscopic staplers. The hypothesis is that the use of polymetric clips for ligation of the appendix will result in decreased operative cost with no change in morbidity when compared to endoscopic staplers. Eligibility will include all patients 18 years or older that are scheduled for laparoscopic appendectomy because of a diagnosis of appendicitis. In conducted trials the risks associated with the use of Hem-o-lok速 for ligation of the appendix is negligible compared to other standard ligation techniques including endoscopic staplers and endoloop. The study team does not perceive any additional risk to study participants beyond the risks associated with laparoscopic appendectomy. The average length of the operation is one and a half hours. Categorical variables will be compared using a Chi-square analysis, while continuous variables will be analyzed using Student's t-test. A statistician with the department has reviewed and approved the "Data Analysis & Statistical Considerations."

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects will be followed for the duration of their hopsital stay, an expected average of 2-3 days.
primary_outcome.description: Charts will be reviewed to calculate the number of days the subject was in the hospital. Clinical and financial outcomes of subjects enrolled for laparoscopic appendectomy using Hem-o-Lok will be compared to a historical (retrospective) cohort of patients who underwent appendectomy using endoscopic staplers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Financial data will be gathered for the duration of the subjects hospital stay, an expected average of 2-3 days.
primary_outcome.description: Data will be gathered on the expense of the subjects hospital stay from admission, surgery, to discharge. Clinical and financial outcomes of subjects enrolled for laparoscopic appendectomy using Hem-o-Lok will be compared to a historical (retrospective) cohort of patients who underwent appendectomy using endoscopic staplers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Length of operation is approximately one and a half hours
primary_outcome.description: Subject's chart will be reviewed to gather operative start and stop times. Clinical and financial outcomes of subjects enrolled for laparoscopic appendectomy using Hem-o-Lok will be compared to a historical (retrospective) cohort of patients who underwent appendectomy using endoscopic staplers.

secondary_outcome.description: Measures of surgical outcomes will be compared between the two procedures including rates of postoperative appendiceal stump dehiscence, hemorrhage, pneumonia, urinary tract infection, myocardial infarction, pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis, and death.

arm_group.description: The study team will prospectively enroll subjects with a diagnosis of appendicitis who are scheduled for laparoscopic appendectomy to have Hem-o-Lok速 clips used for closure of the appendiceal stump. All subjects enrolled in the study will have their medical chart reviewed from consent to 30 days post operatively.

The study team will retrospectively identify patients who have undergone laparoscopic appendectomy during a one year time span by performing a database search. The operative notes will be reviewed for these patients to select patients who underwent ligation of the appendix with an endoscopic stapler.

intervention.description: The study team will prospectively enroll subjects with a diagnosis of appendicitis who are scheduled for laparoscopic appendectomy to have Hem-o-Lok速 clips used for closure of the appendiceal stump.

The study team will retrospectively identify patients who have undergone laparoscopic appendectomy by performing a database search. The operative notes will be reviewed for these patients to select patients who underwent ligation of the appendix with an endoscopic stapler.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. 18 years of age or older
2. scheduled to undergo a laparoscopic appendectomy because of a diagnosis of appendicitis based on clinical history or radiographic imaging.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Less than 18 years of age
2. Signs of appendiceal rupture or abcess on preoperative imaging studies (CT or ultrasound)
3. Inability to provide informed consent
